text:
Whirling Laughter

A bustling dance hall, laughter fills the air.  
Svidrigaïlov: "Look at her! Serves her right!"  
Crowd: "Ha-ha! Shouldn't bring children!"  

---  

A dim, shabby room, Svidrigaïlov sits with a mother.  
Svidrigaïlov: "People here are ill-bred."  
Mother: "Your help is an honor!"  
Svidrigaïlov: "I'll teach your daughter French!"  

---  

A tense moment, Raskolnikov scowls.  
Raskolnikov: "Stop! Enough of your vile anecdotes!"  
Svidrigaïlov: "Oh, but your reactions are delightful!"  
Raskolnikov: "I see I'm ridiculous myself."

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Svidrigaïlov recounts his manipulative encounter with a mother and daughter, highlighting his depravity and the absurdity of their situation.
